text: As a student studying abroad in Argentina I had to watch El secreto de sus ojos for one of my classes and let me say that this trailer does not do justice to the movie that I watched for my class. First the person in the book/movie in Argentina whose love one was raped and murdered was the husband and not the mother of the victim not the co-worker of the detective, secondly Isidro Gomez didn't have a criminal record and kept a low profile after he discovered that the cops were looking for him. He wasn't found by looking through a list of people who had been in jail but by following what he written which was his passions. Also time passes in which the shocking reveal at the end of the movie(which I won't give away for those that might want to check it out) I don't see how they could accomplish a time change with this. Don't watch this American version check out the Argentine version which is closer to the novel.
author: Shawn Flynn

text: Usually when producers remake a movie for a different audience the movie is changed to better suit the target audience. The Argentinian film looked to be more of a romance. This film appears to be more of an action driven drama. Which is more suitable for an American audience. In my opinion action movies are mostly about money not art.  I’d like to see both.
